alert.note: Alert for Carson; Deaf Smith; Moore; Oldham; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:28PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Randall, southwestern Carson, eastern Oldham, northeastern Deaf Smith, Potter and southwestern Moore Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 827 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Masterson to 4 miles west of Valley De Oro to near Vega. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Vega, Bushland, Valley De Oro, Boys Ranch, Masterson, Wildorado, Mescalero Park and Pantex. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.

area.areaDesc: Carson; Deaf Smith; Moore; Oldham; Potter; Randall
